title: What's the meaning behind the song 'It's Raining Men' by The Weather Girls.? - Quora

response.answer_text: It's a feel-good gospel-like, disco upbeat song.  For me, the phrase "it's raining men" means that there is an abundance of [counterparts] about, enough for all, so shake off the blues because you don't need to go very far to find what you're looking for. Amen!  And perhaps something like there's no need for women to fight over another's partner, as is implied in "Mother Nature [...] taught every angel to rearrange the sky so that each and every woman could find her perfect guy."  Moreover, everything is as it should be; the rain too serves a purpose however unpleasant it may be to get caught in it. People often have a negative attitude towards rainy weather, and so they're insisting keep a positive attitude despite bad times ("stormy weather") and even if you have a roof over your head, "rip it off" because there's no hope of finding the [right] partner for you if you stay in cosy circumstances. If you stay at home, in the dry, you might just miss the chance of finding the [man / woman] of your dreams [outside in the real world].  It reminds me of Yoko Ono's song, "Every Man has a Woman Who Loves Her" in which she says "in rain or shine, or life and death." But also, "why do I roam when I know you're the one?"  In this case she feels she has found the man of her dreams and needn't look elsewhere.  That particular song was done in a catchy reggae-ska riddim, which she recently remixed into a dreamy, mystical air.  Finally, James Williams  seems to imply that a song with potential will have had to be released under a separate group "the Weather Girls"  before it could enjoy the success it deserved. (But maybe I'm wrong, but let's not split hairs, guys.)
